docs.abstract: Tech has brought innovation, convenience and smarts to the kitchen. Here’s what Melissa Clark uses and the tools she finds indispensable.
docs.snippet: Tech has brought innovation, convenience and smarts to the kitchen. Here’s what Melissa Clark uses and the tools she finds indispensable.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Melissa Clark, a food writer for The Times, discussed the tech she’s using.

headline.main: The Most Important Kitchen Tools This Holiday (or Any Season, Really)
headline.print_headline: A Pinch of Precision: Tools Make the Meal

docs.abstract: Palladium, a silvery-white metal used in cars and sometimes jewelry, has topped gold in commodities trading for the last three days.
docs.snippet: Palladium, a silvery-white metal used in cars and sometimes jewelry, has topped gold in commodities trading for the last three days.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gold was long the most valuable of precious metals, until, suddenly, it wasn’t.

headline.main: This Metal Is Worth More Than Gold, and It Scrubs Your Car’s Exhaust
headline.print_headline: Pricier Than Gold, And in Your Engine

docs.abstract: Stocks across Wall Street are enduring one of the most prolonged periods of volatility of the past decade.
docs.snippet: Stocks across Wall Street are enduring one of the most prolonged periods of volatility of the past decade.
docs.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

headline.main: Big Swings in Stock Market Are at Their Highest Level Since 2011

docs.abstract: Ms. Dushku told investigators she was written off the hit series ‘Bull’ after enduring sexual harassment on the set. Lawyers scolded CBS for its ‘antiquated’ views.
docs.snippet: Ms. Dushku told investigators she was written off the hit series ‘Bull’ after enduring sexual harassment on the set. Lawyers scolded CBS for its ‘antiquated’ views.
docs.lead_paragraph: In March 2017, Eliza Dushku, an actress known for her work on “Buffy the Vampire Slayer,” signed on to play a major role in three episodes of the CBS prime-time drama “Bull,” and there were plans to make her a full-time cast member.

headline.main: CBS Paid the Actress Eliza Dushku $9.5 Million to Settle Harassment Claims
headline.print_headline: CBS Made Secret Deal With Actress Over Abuse

byline.original: By Rachel Abrams and John Koblin

docs.abstract: Revenue warnings from Apple and Delta Air Lines and weaker manufacturing data suggest that the economy and corporate profits are slowing more than expected.
docs.snippet: Revenue warnings from Apple and Delta Air Lines and weaker manufacturing data suggest that the economy and corporate profits are slowing more than expected.
docs.lead_paragraph: Maybe the markets were not overreacting.

headline.main: Last Month, Investors Seemed Too Pessimistic. Now, They Seem Prescient.
headline.print_headline: Companies Hint That Investors Are Right to Fret About Growth

byline.original: By Peter Eavis and Binyamin Appelbaum

docs.abstract: Together, the merged companies would have nine pharmaceutical products with more than $1 billion in annual sales each. The deal is expected to be completed in the third quarter.
docs.snippet: Together, the merged companies would have nine pharmaceutical products with more than $1 billion in annual sales each. The deal is expected to be completed in the third quarter.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bristol-Myers Squibb said on Thursday that it would buy Celgene, a maker of cancer-fighting drugs, in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $74 billion, the first major pharmaceutical deal of 2019.

headline.main: Bristol-Myers to Acquire Celgene in Deal Worth $74 Billion
headline.print_headline: Bristol-Myers to Acquire Celgene, Fortifying Roster of Cancer Drugs

byline.original: By Tiffany Hsu and Katie Thomas

docs.abstract: Kenichiro Yoshida says he considers Sony “a creative entertainment company” and sees the PlayStation Network as a way to bring Sony movies, shows and music to consumers.
docs.snippet: Kenichiro Yoshida says he considers Sony “a creative entertainment company” and sees the PlayStation Network as a way to bring Sony movies, shows and music to consumers.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — What will happen to Sony Pictures?

headline.main: Sony’s Chief Plans to Make Entertainment Assets a Priority
headline.print_headline: Sony’s Leader Makes More Room for Movies, Shows and Music

docs.abstract: A new study found that most authors’ incomes are below the poverty line.
docs.snippet: A new study found that most authors’ incomes are below the poverty line.
docs.lead_paragraph: Writing has never been a lucrative career choice, but a recent study by the Authors Guild, a professional organization for book writers, shows that it may not even be a livable one anymore.

headline.main: Does It Pay to Be a Writer?
headline.print_headline: How Much Do Writers Make? Hint: Hang on to That Day Job.

docs.abstract: The tech giant’s recent warning about disappointing iPhone sales in China obscured the fact that it is also losing out to Chinese brands in places like France, Germany, India and Southeast Asia.
docs.snippet: The tech giant’s recent warning about disappointing iPhone sales in China obscured the fact that it is also losing out to Chinese brands in places like France, Germany, India and Southeast Asia.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — To most Americans, the names are unfamiliar, maybe a little hard to pronounce: Huawei, Xiaomi, Oppo, Vivo.

headline.main: In Price and Value, Chinese Phone Makers Outpace Apple in Much of the World

docs.abstract: Facing billions of dollars in damages, PG&E and other utilities want legislators to let them pass on the cost to homeowners through higher electricity rates.
docs.snippet: Facing billions of dollars in damages, PG&E and other utilities want legislators to let them pass on the cost to homeowners through higher electricity rates.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — As California’s deadliest wildfire was consuming the town of Paradise in November, some of the state’s top power company officials and a dozen legislators were at an annual retreat at the Fairmont Kea Lani resort on Maui. In the course of four days, they discussed wildfires — and how much responsibility the utilities deserve for the devastation, if any.

headline.main: As Fires Ravaged California, Utilities Lobbied Lawmakers for Protection
headline.print_headline: Passing the Buck as Fires Raged
